intro: Galipea rufescens, commonly known as the red-barked ceiba, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The tree can grow up to 30 meters tall, with a broad, buttressed trunk and a spreading crown. Its bark is thick and reddish-brown, which gives it its common name. Galipea rufescens plays an important ecological role in its habitat, providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
